title: Why We Keep 'Losing' Airplanes
teaser: As the search continues for missing AirAsia Flight 8501, aviation expert Clive Irving says there is no reason for airplanes to disappear without a trace.
contentencoded:
As the search continues for missing AirAsia Flight 8501, The Daily Beast’s aviation expert Clive Irving writes that the plane’s disappearance is an unnecessary tragedy because the technology exists to track and find missing airplanes sooner.

Irving joins Here & Now‘s Lisa Mullins to discuss why the technologies aren’t being used.

  • The Daily Beast: Red Tape and Black Boxes: Why We Keep ‘Losing’ Airliners in 2014

Guest

  • Clive Irving, contributor to the Daily Beast, specializing in aviation, and the author of “Wide-Body: The Triumph of the 747.”
